TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit MobileTextWriter extends System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MultiPartWriter

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Web.Mobile.dll assembly has been deprecated and should no longer be used. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=157231.")

Docs.summary: Provides the base class for all objects used for rendering ASP.NET mobile controls. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MobileTextWriter> class and its inherited classes provide services and helper methods for adapters to perform rendering.

Docs.permission: for operating in a hosted environment. Demand value: ; Permission value: .

Docs.param: The base writer object.
An object of class that provides the capability information for the specific device.
Docs.summary: Creates a new instance of the specified class. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Adapters are usually constructed automatically by ASP.NET and must have a default constructor.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The page adapter must call this method before rendering the page, but after calling the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MobileTextWriter.BeginResponse%2A> method. An exception is raised if the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MobileTextWriter.BeginFile%2A> method is called more than once.

Docs.exception: this method is called more than once.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MobileTextWriter.EnterLayout%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MobileTextWriter.ExitLayout%2A> methods allow a device adapter to emit markup, in order to begin and end a block using the formatting from a given style.
